Hey Dave,

You might also have to go into Cantera/python and do 

% python =
setup.py build
% sudo python setup.py install 

I just reinstalled Cantera =
on a new laptop, forgot to do this step,
and got the same results as the po=
ster, even with your suggested
workaround. It was only once I remembered th=
at I had to explicitly
install the python extensions that this worked for m=
e.


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, Dave Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wrote:
>
>=
 This can happen if your system has 2 different Python installations.   
> =
Mac OS X comes with a version of Python in /usr/bin. But since it  
> usual=
ly not the latest version, many people install their own Python  
> (for ex=
ample, MacPython, which comes with many extras not in the  
> system Python=
, including the IDLE editor.  You need to make sure 

...

> For example, i=
f your Python interpreter is in /usr/ 
> local/bin, then you would set this=
 as follows:
> 
> PYTHON_CMD=3D/usr/local/bin/python
> export PYTHON_CMD
> =

> This syntax is for the "sh" shell; if you are using csh, then the  
> sy=
ntax is a bit different.   You can define this in the preconfig
